name: Contemporary Issues in Engineering
catalog_description: Seminars on engineering topics such as, ethics, life-long education, engineering standards, project management, risk management, change management, entrepreneurship and innovation, sustainable development, effects of engineering applications on health, environment and safety, legal consequences of engineering solutions. A multidisciplinary group work on a selected theme.

name: Computer Aided Technical Drawing
catalog_description: Principles of engineering drawing.Principles of computer aided technical drawing. Design 3D parts with solid modeling, dimensioning and tolerancing. Sectioning and multi-view projections. Assembly modelling and assembling parts. Creating explode view and rendering of assembly drawing. Introduction to animation with Solidworks.
assessment_methods:
Test / Exam
Quiz/Homework
Oral Project
Laboratory Work
Dipnot

name: Materials Science
catalog_description: Materials and properties. Atomic bonding and arrangement. Structural imperfections. Atom movements. Elastic and viscoelastic deformation of materials. Equilibrium diagrams. Metals and their properties. Modification of properties of materials through changes in structure. Advanced materials and their properties.
learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes:
Upon succesful completion of this course, a student will be able to
1. look at materials of different sorts as structures on the atomic level, on the microscopic level and on the macroscopic level.
2. understand why atoms, ions and/or molecules assemble into particular crystal structures.
3. understand how certain structures dictate certain properties.
4. select engineering materials  for different applications
5. identify appropriate materials based on required physical and chemical properties
assessment_methods:
Test / Exam
Quiz/Homework
Presentation (Oral/Poster)

name: Manufacturing Processes
catalog_description: Fundamentals of manufacturing technologies with a special emphasis on manufacturing of metallic parts. Casting, metal forming and metal cutting processes. Manufacturing processes for non-metallic materials and micro-electronics. Economic process design considerations. Material selection for manufacturing. Manufacturing automation.
assessment_methods:

catalog_description: General principles, vector operations, force vectors, equilibrium of a partide, forces and couples, free body diagrams, equilibrium, center of gravity, moment of inertia, introduction to trusses, internal forces, friction, strese-strain, generalized Hooke's law and axial loading

name: Mechanics of Materials
catalog_description: Beam bending. Transverse shear. Torsion. Combined stress due to bending, torsion, shear, and axial load. Stress-strain transformation. Strain rosettes. Deflection of beams and shafts. Energy methods: Virtual work, strain energy.

name: Fluid Mechanics
catalog_description: Fundamental principles of fluid mechanics and their application to engineering problems. Fluid statics. Kinematics of fluid flow. Dynamics of fluids. Differential analysis of fluid flow. Conservation of mass, momentum and energy for fluid flow problems. Flow of viscous fluids, simple laminar flow systems.

catalog_description: Engineering design and thermal systems. Pipeline systems, pipe networks. Pumps, pump systems and power. Mathematical modeling, analysis and simulation of thermal systems. name: Propulsion Systems
catalog_description: Introduction to propulsion systems. Aerothermodynamics of ideal air breathing engines. Non-ideal cycle analysis. Performance of propulsion system components. Matching of compressors and turbines.

name: Pre-thesis Seminar
catalog_description: Determination of thesis subject, problem and research question definition. Preparatory work for thesis such as literature review, hypothesis generation and research on Methodology. Presentation of thesis proposal as a seminar. Attending seminars organized as part of the program.

name: Master’s Thesis I
catalog_description: The first step of master’s thesis performed under the supervision of academic staff.

name: Master’s Thesis II
catalog_description: Master’s thesis performed under the supervision of academic staff. This course must be taken in the semesters where the thesis work is in progress.

name: Thesis Proposal
catalog_description: Emphasis on the importance and novelty of dissertation topic. Thesis proposal is defended in front of a thesis monitoring committee during the semester the course is taken.

name: Ph.D. Dissertation I
catalog_description: Ph.D. dissertation studies performed under supervision of an academic advisor. This course must be taken when dissertation work commences.

catalog_description: Seminars on engineering topics such as, ethics, life-long education, engineering standards, project management, risk management, change management, entrepreneurship and innovation, sustainable development, effects of engineering applications on health, environment and safety, legal consequences of engineering solutions. A multidisciplinary group work on a selected theme.
